videos.title: The Name Game - Identify the Letter That Starts Your Name
videos.description:
Preschoolers love telling you the letter that starts their names. In this musical game from Rock 'N Learn, preschoolers have fun singing about names that start with each letter of the alphabet. When you hear the letter that starts your name, stand up!

Hey, you’re great! You not only know the names of your letters and what they look like, but you also know how to find those tricky letters!

I have an idea. Now that you know your letters, let's play THE NAME GAME. Listen carefully so you'll know what to do. When you hear the letter at the beginning of your name, stand up. Then, when you hear the bell, sit down.

Everyone here has a name
So let's all play a little game
What letter does your name start with?
What letter does your name start with?

Kevin and Kaitlyn start with K
Sam and Sonya start with S 
Becky and Brad start with B
Does your name too? Stand up with me

Felicia and Frank start with F
Oscar and Olivia start with O
Virgil and Vickie start with V
Does your name too? Stand up with me

Lorrie and Larry start with L
Uma and Ulysses start with U 
Cameron and Carol start with C
Does your name too? Stand up with me

Rachel and Ronnie start with R
Yolanda and Yanni start with Y
George and Gwen start with G
Does your name too? Stand up with me

Helen and Harry start with H
Quintin and Quilla start with Q
Zoro and Zamora start with Z
Does your name too? Stand up with me


Xena and Xerxes start with X 
Marvin and Missy start with M
Denise and David start with D
Does your name too? Stand up with me

Now we’re having some fun!

Jerry and Josie start with J
Allen and Amy start with A
Tia and Tony start with T
Does your name too? Stand up with me

Ned and Natasha start with N
William and Wendy start with W
Eddie and Ellen start with E
Does your name too? Stand up with me

Iris and Ivan start with I
Penny and Paul start with P
Does your name too? Stand up with me

Everyone here has a name
We've had some fun and played a game

videos.title: Learn Colors for Babies and Toddlers | Preschool Song
videos.description:
Babies and toddlers love this catchy tune about basic colors. Your preschooler will learn to name colors by singing along when ready.

Let's learn some of the colors by looking at pictures together.  
This will be fun.  Sing the colors with us.

Red apple, red apple
Red...red...red

Orange carrot, orange carrot
Orange...orange...orange

Yellow lemon, yellow lemon
Yellow...yellow...yellow

Green pickle, green pickle
Green...green...green

Blue blueberries, blue blueberries
Blue...blue...blue

Purple plum, purple plum
Purple...purple...purple

Black licorice, black licorice
Black...black...black

White marshmallow, white marshmallow
White...white...white

Brown chocolate, brown chocolate
Brown...brown...brown

videos.title: Colors All Around | Learning Song for Babies and Toddlers
videos.description:
Introduce preschoolers to the beautiful world of colors with this catchy song.

Colors, Colors All Around Lyrics:

Hi kids, I’m Rockin’ Rollie, 
the really radical rock-n-roll round-man, 
and I wanna show you some really cool things: 
the most beautiful things you will ever see… colors!

That’s right, colors are all around us in our wonderful universe.
Let’s sing a song about some of the colors we see every day.

Colors, colors, all around
Oh so many to be found
Colors, colors, everywhere
For the whole wide world to share

The sky is blue, and I can see
White clouds above a big blue sea  
White clouds, blue sea    
Colors all around to see

The dirt is brown the grass is green
And so are all the many trees  
Brown dirt, green tree    
Colors all around to see

A yellow bird is singing to    
An orange striped cat on the ground 
The black dog wants to chase him  
Colors, colors, all around    
                 
A red ball rolls around today
A purple shovel blocks its way
The sun shines down it's light all day 
It makes me want to say      

Colors, colors, all around
Oh so many to be found
Colors, colors, everywhere
For the whole wide world to share

Yeah, yeah, yeah
Colors all around us
They are Everywhere
Yeah, yeah, yeah... Woo!

videos.title: Preschoolers Learn to Say Colors on a Picnic
videos.description:
Young learners learn to look for and identify colors in the world around them as they sing along with this catchy song. 

Tomatoes have a red skin, red skin, red skin
Tomatoes have a red skin, make a salad, put some in

I love eating salad, don’t you?

Ducks can have an orange bill, orange bill, orange bill
Ducks can have an orange bill; colors give me such a thrill

Bananas have a yellow peel, yellow peel, yellow peel
Bananas have a yellow peel, and they make the monkeys squeal.

The pines are always green, green, green 
The pines are always green, and they make the air smell clean

Ah, so clean!

The sky outside is blue, blue, blue
The sky outside is blue, and I know a jay is, too

Oh, look at the blue jay.

I like to eat purple grapes, purple grapes, purple grapes
I like to eat purple grapes, then I make a sound like apes.

Chocolate cake is brown, brown, brown 
Chocolate cake is brown, when I have some I don’t frown.

Ripe olives are so black, black, black 
Ripe olives are so black; I like to eat them as a snack.

Mmmm. Yum, yum!

The fluffy clouds are white, white, white 
The fluffy clouds are white; in the sky they look so bright

Tra la la la la la, la la, la la
Tra la la la la la, tra la la la la la la

videos.title: Learn Shapes for Toddlers | Preschool Song
videos.description:
Kids sign along with this catchy song to learn English words for basic shapes: rectangles, triangles, and circles. 

Come on everyone
Let’s have a super time
We’re going to learn our shapes
And make a rhyme

A circle is round
Like a plate, pie, or penny
If you look for a flat side
It doesn’t have any

Come on everyone
Let’s have a super time
We’re going to learn our shapes
And make a rhyme

A triangle is pointed
Like an ice cream cone
It has three sides
To call its own

Come on everyone
Let’s have a super time
We’re going to learn our shapes
And make a rhyme
 
Now a rectangle 
Is like a door
It has four sides
No less, no more

Come on everyone
We’ve had a super time
Now we’ve  learned some shapes
And made a rhyme

videos.title: Toddlers Learn Shapes | Preschool Song from Rock 'N Learn
videos.description:
Encourage young learners to look for basic shapes everywhere they go with this catchy song. Your preschooler will learn to name shapes.  Is it a circle, triangle, or rectangle? Learn how to identify each shape.

Shapes are all around us, 
For all of us to see
Let’s point to some. 
Just you and me.

A circle is round 
Like a clock that’s on a wall,
A big black tire, 
Or a fun beach ball.

Shapes are all around us, 
For all of us to see
Let’s point to some. 
Just you and me.

A triangle has three sides 
It’s pointed on the end.
Like a little tent,
Standing strong against the wind.

Shapes are all around us, 
For all of us to see
Let’s point to some. 
Just you and me.

Rectangles are easy.
They have four sides. 
I'll tell you what they look like
Just let me be your guide.

Rectangles are found
In windows and in doors,
Books and papers.
Now let’s find some more.

Shapes are all around us, 
For all of us to see
Let’s point to some. 
Just you and me.

videos.title: What Color is It? | Preschool Learning Game | Learn Small, Medium Large
videos.description:
Your preschooler will learn the names of colors and shapes and also what is meant by small, medium, and large. Kids love joining in on this fun game to show off what they know about colors and shapes. Our animated hosts also help preschoolers learn the differences between small, medium, and large sizes.

Now that we know some shapes and colors, let’s play a game called 
“What Color Is It?” 

Look at all the shapes... they are all different sizes.
Some are little, some are big, and some are in between!
We call the little shapes small.  The big shapes are called large.  
And the ones in between small and Large are called medium.  
Neato!  Now, let’s play the fun game “What color is it” with Trollie...

I see a large circle.
What color is it? 
What color is it?
The large circle is. . . PURPLE 

I see a medium triangle.
What color is it? 
What color is it?
The medium triangle is. . . RED

I see a small rectangle.
What color is it? 
What color is it?
The small rectangle is. . . BROWN

I see a large triangle.
What color is it? 
What color is it? 
The large triangle is. . . BLACK

I see a small circle.
What color is it? 
What color is it?
The small circle is. . . BLUE

I see a medium rectangle.
What color is it? 
What color is it?
The medium rectangle is. . . YELLOW

I see a small triangle.
What color is it? 
What color is it?
The small triangle is. . . WHITE

I see a medium circle.
What color is it? 
What color is it?
The medium circle is. . . GREEN

I see a large rectangle. 
What color is it? 
What color is it?
The large rectangle is. . . ORANGE

videos.title: Name That Shape | Preschool Learning Song
videos.description:
Trollie Triangle has a fun game for young learners. Help him find basic shapes and colors in an animated picture while singing along!

Name That Shape lyrics: 

Hey you were super duper! Now let’s play another game. 
This one is called Name That Shape.

I see a black roof on top of the house. 
I see a black roof on top of the house. 
Can you name that shape as quickly as a mouse?
The roof is a triangle.

I see a purple ball that rolls around
I see a purple ball that rolls around
Can you name that shape and then touch the ground?
The ball is a circle.

On the front of the house there is a red door
On the front of the house there is a red door
Can you name its shape before we sing some more?
The door is a rectangle.

I see a blue pond where the ducks like to swim
I see a blue pond where the ducks like to swim
Can you name that shape before we sing again.
The pond is a circle.

I see a green leaf growin’ on a flower
I see a green leaf growin’ on a flower
Can you name that shape and stand tall like a tower?
The leaf is a triangle.

I see a brown post that’s stuck in the ground
It’s a part of a fence; stuck in the ground
Can you name that shape, stand up, and spin around?
The post is a rectangle.

There’s a yellow sun shinin’ in the sky
There’s a yellow sun way up in the sky
Can you name that shape, then wink your eye?
The sun is a circle.

I see an orange beak on a bird that’s black
I see an orange beak on a bird that’s black
Can you name that shape before the ducks go quack?
The beak is a triangle.

I see a white window on the house big and tall
I see a white window on the house big and tall
Can you name that shape and stand straight as a wall?
The window is a rectangle.

videos.title: Learn to Count to 5 | Song for Preschoolers | What Does Zero Mean?
videos.description:
Sing along with Rockford Rectangle as you practice counting to five using fingers, toes, and your mind! Then, get an introduction to the number zero and what it means. 

Well I gotta split, but say hello to my good friend, Rockford Rectangle.

Thank You Trollie.  Pleased to meet you everyone.
Now that you know about shapes and colors, let’s try something new. 
Let’s learn how to count. Hold up one of your hands and sing along. 

Music helps me count to five
On just one hand.
I can count my fingers
And then do it again.

One, two, three, four, five 

Oh, such good counting.

One, two, three, four, five 
One, two, three, four, five 

Music helps me count to five 
With one of my feet.
I can count my toes 
And keep the beat.

One, two, three, four, five

Excellent!
 
One, two, three, four, five 
One, two, three, four, five 

Music helps me count to five
Using just my mind
I can keep the rhythm 
And stay in time.

One, two, three, four, five

That’s the spirit!

One, two, three, four, five
One, two, three, four, five


Zero

What if put my hands behind my back? How many fingers can you count then?

My good friend, you can’t count ANY fingers

Oh no! What are we going to do now?

Do calm down, we can say we see zero fingers.

Zero?

That’s right.  Zero means the same thing as none.

Oh, so when I don’t have any lollipops, I have zero lollipops?

That is correct

Bummer.

Indeed.

videos.title: Telling Time Scenes by Rock ‘N Learn
videos.description:
Here is a sample from Rock 'N Learn Telling Time. 

In today's fast-paced world, kids need to know how to tell time quickly and accurately with both digital and traditional (analog) clocks. Now, it's a breeze with the help of Timothy Time, the Clock That Rocks and his comical friends. Cool music, catchy rhymes, and colorful animation entertain kids of all ages. Kids learn to tell time to the hour, half hour, and quarter hour. They practice using AM and PM, counting by fives, telling time to five minutes, and telling time to the exact minute. They also learn about digital clocks, calendars, days of the week, and months of the year. It's about time!

"I teach 2nd grade at Erickson Elementary School in Tucson, Arizona. I showed your Rock N Learn: Telling Time video to my second graders for the second time today and they absolutely LOVE it! In the ten years that Ive been teaching, I have never seen a better educational video. It is so terrific; it held my interest the whole time! It is so beautifully done and is just great! Not only that, telling time is a very difficult concept for 7-8 year olds to grasp and you not only made it easy, you made it FUN!"—Kelly Munsell

"Timothy Time and Kuku bird teach children how to tell time in this rockin production. Snappy music and short segments will hold young viewers attention as they learn how to tell time."—Parents Guide to Childrens Media

"This exciting video presents lessons about the difficult-to-grasp concept of time. Kids will learn how to read clocks and relate telling time to their everyday lives. This is an educationally valuable tool for home learning." —ReviewCorner.com

videos.title: Colors, Shapes & Counting | Preschool Learning | Rock 'N Learn
videos.description:
Preschool kids love learning colors, shapes, and counting to 20 by Rock 'N Learn. Young learners enjoy these preschool readiness songs that include learning to count objects by color, shape, or a combination of both. Even gifted children will be challenged by the advanced colors (maroon, turquoise) and shapes (polygons, ellipses). Includes counting up to 20.

Colors, Shapes & Counting features the comical adventures of Rollie Roundman, Trollie Triangle, and Rockford Rectangle. These playful characters help preschoolers master basic skills and concepts through songs, laughter, and games. Children will be so captivated by the bright, action-packed animation and engaging songs, they'll want to watch and play again and again.

Preschoolers review the basic colors and also learn maroon and turquoise. They discover polygons, trapezoids, the differences between a square and a rectangle, and more. Includes important preschool sorting skills. A deluxe, colorful board book with sturdy pages is also available (sold separately) at www.rocknlearn.com.

videos.title: Identify Letters for Kids - Funny Looking Letters Game
videos.description:
Kids learn to recognize letters in different fonts and styles while playing along with this fun game.

Sometimes you will see letters that look a little different from what you've learned. Let's play a game so you will be able to recognize the funny looking letters. First, I will ask you to tell me what color a letter is, then I will say the answer. Try to answer before I do.

Look for the G's all around 
Tell me their color and touch the ground

The G's are blue   

Look at the letters and tell me please
What color are the letter T's?

The T's are red.  

Look all around for the letter A's
Tell me their color before I say

The A's are green.  

Now look for the letter K's
Tell me their color before I say.

The K's are orange. 

Look up and down for all the Q's
Say their color before I do

The Q's are purple.  

Look for W's as our last one
Tell me their color then we'll be done

The W's are pink

videos.title: Humpty Dumpty Sat on the Wall
videos.description:
Humpty Dumpty should have been more careful! Sing along with the classic nursery rhyme, then learn a new song about staying safe.

Humpty Dumpty song lyrics:

Humpty Dumpty sat on a wall.
Humpty Dumpty had a great fall.
All the king’s horses and all the king’s men
Couldn’t put Humpty together again.

"We Need to Be Careful"

We need to be careful
When we have fun.
Remember these rhymes
And tell everyone.

Get permission
Before you go to play,
So you can be found
Right away.

Look both ways 
Before you cross the street.
Then when it's clear
Just move your feet. 

But only cross the street when you have permission.

We need to be careful
When we have fun.
Remember these rhymes
And tell everyone.

videos.title: Three Little Kittens
videos.description:
Sing along with this popular nursery rhyme and learn an important lesson. When we work together, we have more time to do fun things together!

Once three little kittens lost their mittens and they began to cry,
“Oh, mother dear, we sadly fear, our mittens we have lost.”
“What? You lost your mittens? You naughty kittens. 
Then you shall have no pie.”
Meow, meow, meow, meow

The three little kittens they found their mittens, 
and they began to cry,
“Oh, mother dear, see here, see here. Our mittens we have found.”
“What? You found your mittens? You good little kittens. 
Then you shall have some pie.
Meow, meow, meow, meow

The three little kittens put on their mittens, 
and soon ate up their pie.
“Oh mother dear, we greatly fear, our mittens we have soiled.”
“What? You soiled your mittens? You naughty kittens.”
Then they began to sigh.
Meow, meow, meow, meow

The three little kittens, they washed their mittens, 
and hung them out to dry.
“Oh, mother dear, look here, look here. Our mittens we have washed.”
“What? You washed your mittens? You good little kittens. 
But I smell a rat close by.”
Meow, meow, meow, meow

videos.title: Telling Time to the Half Hour | Songs and Rhymes
videos.description:
Watch the full length video here: 
https://youtu.be/r2K1Py9U87I

Also available on DVD:
https://www.rocknlearn.com/products/telling-time-dvd

Learn how to tell time using a traditional clock with hands up to the half hour. This award-winning video starts off helping kids understand why a clock has hands and exactly what the hour hand, minute hand, and second hand do. Rhythmic songs with rhymes make learning about telling time easy and fun. Timothy Time, the Clock that Rocks, naturally knows how to tell time and loves sharing his enthusiasm with young learners. His friend Kuku brings fun and surprises along with more eagerness to learn.

If you are looking for a kids’ video for telling time with songs and rhymes, we believe you will find this one quite useful. This animated video is designed to hold interest and get results. After learning how a clock works and the function of each hand, kids start off easy by learning how to tell time to the full hour. With plenty of fun examples and practice, kids are soon ready to learn how to tell time to the half hour. This is a perfect stopping point so that your child may watch this YouTube video again and again to develop skills and proficiency. It’s a fast-paced world. Your child will be telling time in no time!

Be sure to subscribe to our Rock ‘N Learn YouTube channel so that you will get updates as we release many more educational videos for preschool through fifth grade. We are working on some truly exciting projects, great ways to entertain little ones and help all kids learn. You don’t want to miss out.

After mastering this material, your child will be ready for more telling time video instruction. The full video, available at links below, also includes telling time to the quarter hour, practice counting by fives, telling time to five minutes, telling time to the exact minute, and practice with digital clocks. Plus, it includes bonus material for learning about calendars, days of the week, and months of the year. Recommended for first grade and up. Rock ‘N Learn Telling Time video also works well with advanced learners at younger ages.

Full video (DVD) available at: https://www.rocknlearn.com/collections/math-dvds/products/telling-time-dvd

Full video download (MP4 file) available at: 
https://www.rocknlearn.com/collections/math-downloads/products/telling-time-video-download

Also available for rent or purchase on Amazon:
https://www.amazon.com/Telling-Time-Brad-Caudle/dp/B079YXF91W/ref=sr_1_1

videos.title: Mary Had a Little Lamb
videos.description:
Sing along with this classic nursery rhyme. Here are the words to Mary Had a Little Lamb:

Mary had a little lamb
Little lamb, little lamb.
Mary had a little lamb.
Its fleece was white as snow.

And everywhere that Mary went,
Mary went, Mary went
And everywhere that Mary went,
The lamb was sure to go.

It followed her to school one day
School one day, school one day.
It followed her to school one day
Which was against the rules.

It made the children laugh and play
Laugh and play, laugh and play.
It made the children laugh and play
To see a lamb at school.

videos.title: Three Little Pigs Song
videos.description:
Kids love this song that tells a classic children’s story about three little pigs going out into the world to build their houses and eventually facing the big, bad wolf. What choices do these little pigs make? Here you will find a lively kids’ song that provides the main points of the story and keeps a kid-friendly style appropriate for all ages. Have fun singing along!

The Three Little Pigs Song Lyrics:

Ooo, oh yeah!

Three little pigs built their houses one day.
The first little pig built his house out of straw.
But he didn’t like it, he didn’t like it
when the wolf came along.
He wasn’t happy, he wasn’t happy at all.

Little pig, little pig, let me in. 
Not by the hair of my chinny chin chin.
Then I’ll huff and I’ll puff, and I’ll blow your house in.

Oooo. Ha ha ha, that’s right, baby! I’m the big bad wolf!

Three little pigs built their houses one day.
The second little pig built his house out of sticks.
But he didn’t like it, he didn’t like it
when the wolf came along.
He was in an awful, he was in an awful fix.

Little pig, little pig, let me in.
Not by the hair of my chinny chin chin.
Then I’ll huff, and I’ll puff, and I’ll blow your house in.

Ooo Ha ha!

Three little pigs built their houses one day.
The third little pig built his house out of bricks.
And he was ready, he was ready
when the wolf came along,
‘Cause he had not used any straw or sticks.

No way.

Little pig, little pig, let me in. 
Not by the hair of my chinny chin chin.
Then I’ll huff, and I’ll puff, and I’ll blow your house in.

Oooo. Ha ha ha.  Hey, wait a minute 
the house is suppose to fall down. 

It didn’t!

I’m the big bad wolf and I huffed and I puffed. 
But wait nothing’s happening. 

You silly wolf, you can’t blow down bricks. 

Oh, you little pigs stop that give me some respect. 
I’m the big bad wolf, now. 

You can’t blow down my brick house.

I’ll blow your house in. I will, I’ll huff and puff. 

Just do all you want. Huff and puff. 

Just you wait, you’ll see. 

Blow yourself blue in the face. You can’t blow down bricks. 

You better watch out. I’m gonna blow your house down. 
I will, just you wait and see. 

This story about the three little pigs and big, bad wolf can be used as a teaching lesson about building your life with a solid foundation. You will be much better prepared to face life’s challenges though careful planning, getting a good education, and developing your skills. Hard work and persistence will pay off. Too often, we don’t teach kids the importance of planning and being prepared for unforeseen adversity. That especially applies to health and finances but other areas as well. Whenever we build a solid foundation using good values and habits, it doesn’t mean our lives will be easy. It means we can better handle tough times and be ready when good opportunities come along. Not only does it help us, but we can better serve and protect the ones we love and care about.

The straw and sticks represent lazy habits and only living for the moment. They symbolize lacking self-discipline. The story of the three little pigs is a true classic tale that dates back to at least a published version in 1890, but it’s probably much older than that.

videos.title: Baby Shark Song for Kids
videos.description:
Baby Shark is a fun song for kids to enjoy singing along. Baby Shark, Momma Shark, Daddy Shark, Grandma Shark, and Grandpa Shark swim together. They swim away from a giant squid, swim with a remora, and discover a seahorse. 

A remora is a ray-finned fish that attaches itself to the body of other fish to travel in the ocean. Remoras eat leftovers from the skin of sharks and keep the sharks clean.  Sharks and remoras help each other. Although remoras can swim on their own, they do not have a swim bladder and have trouble swimming long distances. So, it’s great when they can attach to a shark or other sea animal.

videos.title: The Ugly Duckling Song
videos.description:
Based on a classic children’s tale, this kids song relates to modern day concerns about how it can feel when someone is different and gets teased or bullied by others. This video with song lyrics can be useful during discussions about bullying and why any teasing or isolating other kids can have serious consequences. It also helps to know that many problems arise when we don’t learn to look for the good in others. It you try to reach out to someone who is being avoided by other kids, you can help them feel accepted, discover new things about them, and feel good being a friend to someone in need. If you are someone being teased, please know that you have many special qualities inside that will get better as you get older. Many kids go through an awkward stage where they feel like they don’t belong. It’s good to have talks with adults willing to listen. Make sure children have the resources they need, including trained counselors if necessary. It’s been over 170 years since Hans Christian Andersen wrote the story, but the message has much relevance today in a society that tends to teach people to value others by how they look. Most people can recall a moment in their lives when they felt like they didn’t measure up to those around them.


A mother duck sat on her nest
waiting for her eggs to hatch.
One egg was rather large in size.
It had no other match.

"Peep, peep," said the newborn ducks.
"Quack, quack," said their mother.
One duck was strange, one duck was odd.
He didn't look like the others.

He didn't look like the others.
He didn't look like he belonged.
Nobody there seemed to know
that he was a beautiful swan.

The mother took her ducklings to the water.
Other ducks were staring at him.
They said the one duckling was ugly.
But my how he could swim!

Each day that passed, the worse it got.
The animals teased the ugly one.
They pushed and shoved, calling out to him.
They never seemed to tire of making fun.

‘Cause he didn't look like the others. (the others)  
He didn't look like he belonged.
Nobody there seemed to know
that he was a beautiful swan.

At last our friend could stand no more.
He decided to run away.
He wanted to find a fun, safe place
where he could swim and play.

He came to a swamp where some wild ducks lived.
He chose this for his home
Until one day a hunter came,  
he knew again that he must roam.

And he didn’t look like the others. 
He didn’t look like he belonged. 
Nobody there seemed to know
that he was a beautiful swan. 

Everywhere our friend would go, 
The story would seem the same. 
Never welcome anywhere, 
it really was a shame. 

Until one day when he was grown, 
something strange occurred. 
Oh, whose reflection could that be?
Who was that beautiful bird?

Well, he didn’t look like the others. 
He had grown so big and strong.
Everybody finally knew
that he was a beautiful swan. 

Try not to judge by how someone looks.
Find out what’s within.
A lovely swan may live inside.
The beauty’s beneath our skin. 

If you treat others by how they look, 
That’s not being too smart. 
Oh, look inside to find their worth. 
What’s important is in the heart. 

Don’t you know that everyone is different?
But everybody can belong, 
if deep inside us, in our hearts, 
there lives a beautiful swan. 

There lives a beautiful swan. 
Oh, there lives a beautiful swan.

videos.title: The Little Red Hen Song
videos.description:
The Little Red Hen Song is based on a kids folk tale teaching children basic moral values: Be thrifty, take initiative, plan ahead, work hard, be self-reliant, and persevere.

Kids also learn about fairness. When the other animals refuse to help grow wheat, make flour, and bake bread they do not get to share the reward of eating the bread. Original music sung in a parody style of gritty 80s rock, this kids tune brings lots of fun while portraying bold lessons about values. It’s as though the song’s raw energy reflects the realistic truths about living a highly successful life.

The Little Red Hen song lyrics:

The little red hen found some wheat.
If we plant it, we can make a treat.

Who will help me make it grow so high?
The duck, the rat, and the pig all said, “Not I!”

“Well, if you will not help me then
I’ll do it myself,” said the little red hen.

The wheat grew up and turned yellow.
If we cut it, we can make some bread, you know.

Who will help me cut this wheat that’s high?
The duck, the rat, and the pig all said, “Not I!”

“Well, if you will not help me then.
I’ll do it myself,” said the little red hen.

Oooo . . . yeah!

Ooo, we need the miller to make flour from the wheat
before we can bake a tasty treat.

Who will help me carry this bag that’s tied?
The duck, the rat, and the pig all said, “Not I!”

“Well, if you will not help me then.
I’ll do it myself,” said the little red hen.

We need to use the flour to make the bread.
If you’ll come and help me, we can all be fed.

Who will help me bake the bread tonight?
The duck, the rat, and the pig all said, “Not I, no !”

“Well, if you will not help me then
I’ll do it myself,” said the little red hen.

The bread came out so warm and sweet.
The duck, rat, and pig came running to eat.

Oh no, no... “Because you would not help then
I’ll eat it myself,” said the little red hen.

videos.title: Jack and the Beanstalk Song
videos.description:
Jack and the Beanstalk is a favorite classic children’s story. Kids love this energetic tune that parents can use to discuss finding opportunity while exercising restraint when confronted with increasing and dangerous risk. This could apply to many situations in life where people never find happiness or satisfaction no matter what they accomplish. Mostly, this song provides fun kids entertainment.  

Jack needed money so that he could buy food.
His mother said, "Jack, go sell the cow."
But Jack traded for some magic beans instead,
And take a look at what's happened now...

(chorus)
Beanstalk, beanstalk growin' up so high.
Beanstalk, beanstalk reachin' to the sky.
Jack climbed the beanstalk,
And much he did find.
He climbed that beanstalk three magical times.

Now when Jack first climbed to the giant's house
He looked around and what did he see?
The giant's gold coins—they caught Jack's eye.
Jack said, "I want these for me."

Jack took the gold coins and down he went.
He gave them to his mom on the ground.
His mother was so pleased with what she saw;
She started jumping up and down.
Mother: Oh Jack, this is FANTASTIC!

Jack and his mother did enjoy the gold coins.
They always had plenty of food,
But then one day no more coins were left.
His mom said, "What will we do?"

(chorus)
Beanstalk, beanstalk growin' up so high.
Beanstalk, beanstalk reachin' to the sky.
Jack climbed the beanstalk,
And much he did find.
He climbed that beanstalk three magical times.

On the second climb Jack saw a wonderful hen.
Gold eggs were what that hen could lay.
Jack grabbed the hen and went back down—
Another great magical day!

But Jack was greedy and he wanted more.
He wondered what else might be up there.
Gold eggs were great and they paid the rent,
But Jack went back without any care.


(chorus)
Beanstalk, beanstalk growin' up so high.
Beanstalk, beanstalk reachin' to the sky.
Jack climbed the beanstalk,
And much he did find.
He climbed that beanstalk three magical times.

The giant's golden harp was what Jack saw.
Jack felt this was what he must have.
He grabbed the golden harp, but the harp cried out,
And awoke the giant up from his nap!

This time the giant was fast on his feet.
Ferociously he chased after Jack.
Jack was so scared, he ran as fast as he could,
But he almost had a heart attack!

The story as you know turns out okay,
But Jack learned all about greed.
Be happy with the things you have,
And don't ever take more than you need.

(chorus)
Beanstalk, beanstalk growin' up so high.
Beanstalk, beanstalk reachin' to the sky.
Jack climbed the beanstalk,
And much he did find.
He climbed that beanstalk three magical times.

Beanstalk, beanstalk
Beanstalk, beanstalk
Jack climbed the beanstalk,
And much he did find.
He climbed that beanstalk three magical times.

videos.title: Going to St. Ives | Nursery Rhyme for Kids
videos.description:
This traditional nursery rhyme goes back many years and presents a riddle. The earliest published version is from around 1730. This version was printed around 1825. Kids love discovering that no matter how hard they try to count the people, animals, and sacks, the answer is really quite simple if it’s only the narrator. However, if all were headed to St. Ives, the complex mathematical answer is 2802.  Two males, 7 females, 49 sacks, 343 cats, and 2401 kittens. Most interpretations of this riddle assume the narrator is going the opposite direction from the others, so the answer is only one. He’s the only one actually stated that is going to St. Ives. 

As I was going to St Ives song lyrics: 

As I was going to St. Ives,
I met a man with seven wives,
Each wife had seven sacks,
Each sack had seven cats,
Each cat had seven kits:
Kits, cats, sacks, and wives,
How many were going to St. Ives?
 
This modern day version of the song does not have to be about one man having multiple wives. These women could be the man’s daughters; they actually look alike, right? So check this out… they are all married, different husbands, so that’s why they are all called wives in the song. What do you think?

Five Little Ducks - Song for Kids
videos.description:
"Five Little Ducks" is a fun counting song for babies, toddlers, and preschoolers. It can be used to develop early skills to help kids count to five. Here are lyrics for Five Little Ducks:

Five little ducks went out one day
Over the hill and far away
Mother duck called with a quack, quack, quack 
Quack, quack, quack 
But only four little ducks came back

Four little ducks went out one day
Over the hill and far away
Mother duck called with a quack, quack, quack 
Quack, quack, quack 
But only three little ducks came back

Three little ducks went out one day
Over the hill and far away
Mother duck called with a quack, quack, quack 
Quack, quack, quack 
But only two little ducks came back

Two little ducks went out one day
Over the hill and far away
Mother duck called with a quack, quack, quack 
Quack, quack, quack 
But only one little ducks came back

One little duck went out one day
Over the hill and far away
Mother duck called with a quack, quack, quack 
Quack, quack, quack 
But none of the little duck came back

Sad mother duck went out one day
Over the hill and far away
The sad mother duck said, "Quack, quack, quack" 
Quack, quack, quack 
And all of the five little ducks came back

Five little ducks went out one day
Over the hill and far away
Mother duck called with a quack, quack, quack 
Quack, quack, quack 
And all of the five little ducks came back

videos.title: Jack and Jill Went Up the Hill - Nursery Rhyme Song for Kids
videos.description:
Jack and Jill

Sing along with the classic tale and traditional melody kids' song Jack and Jill. Seems Jack made a crown out of construction paper while at school. He's not too happy about breaking it, right? But so much better than breaking his other crown... his head.

With vinegar and brown paper

videos.title: Sing a Song of Sixpence  | Nursery Rhyme for Kids
videos.description:
Here's a favorite nursery rhyme that is popular with young and old. Sing along with this zippy version and subscribe for more songs for kids. 

Sing a Song of Sixpence Lyrics:

Sing a song of sixpence,
A pocket full of rye
Four-and-twenty blackbirds 
Baked in a pie

When the pie was opened 
The birds began to sing
Now wasn’t that a dainty dish 
To set before the King?

The King was in his counting house,
Counting out his money
The queen was in the parlor,
Eating bread and honey

The maid was in the garden,
Hanging out the clothes
There came along a blackbird 
And pecked off her nose.

videos.title: On Top of Spaghetti
videos.description:
This classic kids' song is a spoof of the folk song "On Top of Old Smokey" with lots of funny surprises. 

Be sure to check out the sequel here:
https://youtu.be/hbeL4Gagmrc 

Here are the lyrics to On Top of Spaghetti so that you can sing along with this fun kids’ song. 

On Top of Spaghetti

On top of spaghetti, 
All covered with cheese,
I lost my poor meatball, 
When somebody sneezed.

It rolled off the table,
And on to the floor,
And then my poor meatball,
Rolled out of the door.

It rolled in the garden,
And under a bush,
And then my poor meatball,
Was nothing but mush.

The mush was as tasty
As tasty could be,
And then the next summer, 
It grew into a tree.

The tree was all covered,
All covered with moss,
And on it grew meatballs,
And tomato sauce.

So if you eat spaghetti,
All covered with cheese,
Hold on to your meatball,
Whenever you sneeze.

Wonderful, wonderful… now everybody sing along.

videos.title: BINGO Was His Name-O | Dog Song for Kids
videos.description:
Here's  a favorite kids’ song about a dog named Bingo. It’s great at home, preschool, or for kindergarten class participation. In our version, Bingo belongs to a cute little girl. So much fun to sing along and clap. Helps develop spelling skills, rhythm, counting, and socialization.

Featuring vocals from the amazing Luci Christian!

Bingo lyrics: 

There was a girl who had a dog,
and Bingo was his name-o.
B-I-N-G-O
B-I-N-G-O
B-I-N-G-O
And Bingo was his name-o.

Now, leave off the first letter and clap.

There was a girl who had a dog,
and Bingo was his name-o.
(clap)-I-N-G-O
(clap)-I-N-G-O
(clap)-I-N-G-O
And Bingo was his name-o.

Now, clap for the first two letters.

and Bingo was his name-o.

(clap)-(clap)-N-G-O
(clap)-(clap)-N-G-O
And Bingo was his name-o.

This time, clap for the first three letters.

and Bingo was his name-o.
(clap)-(clap)-(clap)-G-O
(clap)-(clap)-(clap)-G-O
(clap)-(clap)-(clap)-G-O
And Bingo was his name-o.

Let’s clap for the first four letters.

There was a girl who had a dog,
and Bingo was his name-o.
(clap)-(clap)-(clap)-(clap)-O
(clap)-(clap)-(clap)-(clap)-O
(clap)-(clap)-(clap)-(clap)-O
And Bingo was his name-o.

Now clap for all five letters.

There was a girl who had a dog,
and Bingo was his name-o.
(clap)-(clap)-(clap)-(clap)-(clap)
(clap)-(clap)-(clap)-(clap)-(clap)
(clap)-(clap)-(clap)-(clap)-(clap)
And Bingo was his name-o.

videos.title: Baby’s First Words - Colors, Clothes, Toys & More | When will my toddler speak?
videos.description:
This video promotes early speech development and vocabulary using a format recommended by speech and language professionals. Below are links to each section of the video:

00:00   Rock 'N Learn Title Screen  
00:06  Things Around the House
04:00  Colors
07:24  Clothing 
09:33  Toys

More First Words videos are here:

Baby’s First Words - Food, Activities & Animals 
https://youtu.be/hACN6hbslMc

Baby’s First Words – Body Parts, Family & More 
https://youtu.be/9tAY5kHRWsg

Baby's First Words & Phrases
https://youtu.be/L0N1v6cxb0o

Your child watches fun characters explore indoor worlds. Eventually, your child starts speaking along. The captivating mouth on screen is helpful for proper pronunciation.  As young children become ready, they develop proper articulation skills through imitation, often for the first time. 

Luci Christian, an award-winning voice actress appearing in dozens of films, uses her talents to get little learners tuned in and talking. Especially useful when you’re concerned your child may not be talking as much as peers. Help ease the frustration of not being able to communicate. 

Busy parents appreciate this self-paced approach children can use with minimal assistance. Along with critical phrases to communicate their needs, children learn colors, toys, clothes, and furniture. Includes more than 50 words and phrases.

Let’s go even faster. 

Head, shoulders, knees, and toes - knees and toes

And eyes and ears and mouth and nose

videos.title: Reading CVC Words and Simple Phrases
videos.description:
Are you ready to boost reading skills? Below are links to each section of this video:

00:00   Rock 'N Learn Title Screen  
00:05  Find the Sounds
02:21  Sound it Out
05:13  Putting it All Together
08:45  CVC Rhyming Words

This video begins with two phonics games to encourage kids to join in. Kick off the learning fun by playing along with “Find the Sounds,” a phonics game to practice phonemic segmentation. Then, Chip the Robot zooms in to play “Sound it Out” and practice oral blending.
 
Then, get valuable practice reading Consonant-Vowel-Consonant words with a fun music video for the song “Putting at all Together.” 

To wrap things up, rhyming couplets of Consonant-Vowel-Consonant words make fun phrases to go along with colorful illustrations. Kids will love reading along with Brad and Chip the Robot. 

Phonemic segmentation can be used to help with spelling. It takes a word that learners hear and splits it into its sounds. Students then identify the sounds and think of the letters that go with each sound to spell a word.

Oral blending uses the reverse process: taking the letters in a word, thinking of the sounds that they make, and blending them together to make a word. Both segmentation and blending are important phonics skills to boost reading skills and spelling ability. 

Using video as part of a lesson can help students retain more information and develop a better understanding of concepts. This video is useful to introduce the concepts of phonemic segmentation and oral blending. It is also great for daily practice.

Oh, have you seen the firefighter,
Who lives on Drury Lane?    

hmmm.....
I have not seen the firefighter
Who lives on Drury Lane

Really?  ... Then, 
Let's go see the firefighter,
The firefighter, the firefighter,
Let's go see firefighter,
Who lives on Drury Lane

Here she is! The firefighter!

So, now we know the firefighter,
The firefighter, the firefighter,
Oh yes, we know the firefighter,
Who lives on Drury Lane

Oh no, not again!

Oh, have you seen my dog get out?
Your dog gets out?
My dog IS out.
Oh now I see:  
Your dog got out
And ran down Drury lane

But look who's coming now!
Oh have you seen the dog catcher,
The dog catcher, the dog catcher?
Oh yes, I've seen the dog catcher
Who lives on Drury lane

And just whose dog might THIS be?

It's my dog, sir. Sorry about that!

Please remember to keep your dog on a leash!

I will ... 
uh, oh - looks like rain. Follow me!

Oh, have you seen the Zany Rainy Bread Lady
The Zany Rainy Bread Lady?
The Zany Rainy Bread Lady!
Oh, have you seen the Zany Rainy Bread Lady
Her name is hard to say

Oh, we have seen the Zany Rainy Bread Lady
The Zany Rainy Bread Lady
The Zany Rainy Bread Lady
Oh, yes we've seen the Zany Rainy Bread Lady
And we can say her name

can YOU?
the Zany  ...  Rainy  ...  Bread  ...  Lady

videos.title: The Woodchuck Song | Tongue Twister for Kids
videos.description:
How much wood would a woodchuck chuck if a woodchuck could chuck wood? We’ve got the answer in much more in this silly song based on the classic tongue twister. Can you keep up when things start getting crazy? Even if you can’t, enjoy laughing along with this entertaining song for kids of all ages.

The Woodchuck Song lyrics:

Well hello there!
Hello, Hello!
Hey, I've got a question for you...

How much wood would a woodchuck chuck if a woodchuck could chuck wood?

How much wood would a woodchuck chuck if a woodchuck could chuck wood?

A woodchuck would chuck as much wood as a woodchuck could chuck if a woodchuck could chuck wood.

That makes sense. 
It certainly does.
You know, I've got a friend who's a woodchuck. His name's Chuck.
That's a good name for a woodchuck...

How much wood would a woodchuck named Chuck chuck if a woodchuck named Chuck could chuck wood?

How much wood would a woodchuck named Chuck chuck if a woodchuck named Chuck could chuck wood?

A woodchuck named Chuck would chuck as much wood as a woodchuck named Chuck could chuck if a woodchuck named Chuck could chuck wood.

Now that you mention it, I think I've seen Chuck driving around town.
Wow, I didn't know Chuck could drive. What kind of car does he have? 

Oh, Chuck doesn't have a car. He drives a truck.

Uh oh. 
How much wood would a woodchuck named Chuck in a truck chuck if a woodchuck named Chuck in a truck could chuck wood?

How much wood would a woodchuck named Chuck in a truck chuck if a woodchuck named Chuck in a truck could chuck wood?

A woodchuck named Chuck in a truck would chuck as much wood as a woodchuck named Chuck in a truck could chuck if a woodchuck named Chuck in a truck could chuck wood.

Yep, there goes ol' Chuck now. Say... who is that in the car with him. 

I'm don't know, but I'm pretty sure it's a duck. 

This could get interesting...

How much wood would a woodchuck named Chuck in a truck with a duck chuck if a woodchuck named Chuck in a truck with a duck could chuck wood?

How much wood would a woodchuck named Chuck in a truck with a duck chuck if a woodchuck named Chuck in a truck with a duck could chuck wood?

A woodchuck named Chuck in a truck with a duck would chuck as much wood as a woodchuck named Chuck in a truck with a duck could chuck if a woodchuck named Chuck in a truck with a duck could chuck wood.

Alright! Now, let's see if you can do it. I'll break it down nice and slow...

How much wood... 

...would a woodchuck chuck...

...if a woodchuck could chuck wood?

Nice! Now sing it with us:

How much wood would a woodchuck chuck if a woodchuck could chuck wood?

How much wood would a woodchuck chuck if a woodchuck could chuck wood?

A woodchuck would chuck as much wood as a woodchuck could chuck if a woodchuck could chuck wood.

videos.title: Over in the Meadow | Songs for Kids
videos.description:
This classic song for kids is great for young learners who are beginning to count to ten. You may find yourself tapping your feet and singing along with this catchy melody. 

Over in the Meadow lyrics:

Over in the meadow
In the sand in the sun
Lived a kind mother turtle
And her little turtle one
"Wink!" said the mother
"I wink!" said the one
So they winked and they blinked
In the sand in the sun

Over in the meadow
Where the stream runs blue
Lived an shiny mother fish
And her little fishes two
"Swim!" said the mother
"We swim!" said the two
So they swam and they swam
Where the stream runs blue

Over in the meadow
In a hole in a tree
Lived a wise mother owl
And her little owls three
"Hoot!" said the mother
"We hoot!" said the three
So they hooted and hooted
Near a hole in the tree

Over in the meadow
In a lodge near the shore
Lived a brown mother beaver
And her little beavers four
"Dive!" said the mother
"We dive!" said the four
So they dove and they splashed
By the lodge near the shore

Over in the meadow
In a snug beehive
Lived a mother honey bee
And her little bees five
"Buzz!" said the mother
"We buzz!" said the five
So they buzzed and they hummed
In the snug beehive 

Over in the meadow
In a nest built of sticks
Lived a black mother crow
And her little crows six
"Caw!" said the mother
"We caw!" said the six
So they cawed and they called
In their nest built of sticks

Over in the meadow
When the clock strikes eleven 
There's a noisy mother cricket
And her little crickets seven
"Chirp!" said the mother
"We chirp!" said the seven
So they chirped cheery notes
When the clock struck eleven

Over in the meadow
By the old mossy gate
Lived a scaly mother lizard
And her little lizards eight
"Bask!" said the mother
"We bask!" said the eight
So they basked in the sun
On the old mossy gate

Over in the meadow
Where the quiet pools shine
Lived a green mother frog
And her little froggies nine
"Croak!" said the mother
"We croak!" said the nine
So they croaked and they splashed
Where the quiet pools shine

Over in the meadow
In a nice little den
Lived a gray mother spider
And her little spiders ten
"Spin!" said the mother
"We spin!" said the ten
So they spun lacy webs
In their nice little den

videos.title: Sight Words Level 2 - Kindergarten Reading Boost
videos.description:
Sight words are the most frequently used words in children's literature, and this video helps students read them automatically. As a supplement to phonics-based strategies, Rock 'N Learn Sight Words boosts reading and spelling skills. Children learn over 60 sight words through engaging characters, entertaining songs, and fun practice. Words are presented in context to help build reading comprehension. Includes all primer Dolch words and many from Fry's list. Some pre-primer Dolch words are reviewed as well. 
After Sight Words Level 2, learners can advance to:
Sight Words Level 3 https://youtu.be/LCkxiQgcRQY
Or for more basic practice: Sight Words Level 1 https://youtu.be/wgrtvyu1fOY

videos.title: Skip to the Loo - Remind Kids to Go to Bathroom
videos.description:

In some places, they call the bathroom the loo.

Skip, skip, skip to the loo
Skip, skip, skip to the loo
Skip, skip, skip to the loo
Skip to the loo my darling

Going on a trip, what should you do?
Before a long ride, what should you do?
Before you leave, what should you do?
Skip to the loo my darling

Skip, skip, skip to the loo
Skip, skip, skip to the loo
Skip, skip, skip to the loo
Skip to the loo my darling

I like playing and so do you
I like playing and so do you
Still there’s something that I must do
Skip to the loo my darling

Skip, skip, skip to the loo
Skip, skip, skip to the loo
Skip, skip, skip to the loo
Skip to the loo my darling

Wash your hands after you do
Wash your hands after you do
Wash your hands after you do
Skip to the loo my darling

Skip, skip, skip to the loo
Skip, skip, skip to the loo
Skip, skip, skip to the loo
Skip to the loo my darling

Who needs to potty? Who, who, who?
Who needs to potty? How about you?
Who needs to potty? Me too!
Let’s skip to the loo my darling


Skip, skip, skip to the loo
Skip, skip, skip to the loo
Skip, skip, skip to the loo
Skip to the loo my darling

videos.title: Reading Consonant Combinations | Letter Sounds Part 3
videos.description:
Learn how to sound out words that contain two letters that make a blended sound. With fun practice, it’s easy to read words with consonant blends. Kids also learn to spell simple words by reversing the process and listening for the sounds in words with consonant blends. Finally, children learn to listen carefully to hear the sounds in words and practice swapping sounds to make new words. This is Part 3 of the official Rock ‘N Learn Letter Sounds: Phonics for Beginners.

videos.description:
Learn the skills to become a good reader. This video is perfect for preschoolers or those needing to improve their reading. Starting off easy, kids sing the uppercase and lowercase letters of the English alphabet. Next, kids learn and practice saying the most common sound each letter makes. An on-screen mouth shows how to form the sounds. Kids enjoy applying their new skills by racing the clock to say letter sounds in silly sentences before hearing the answers. videos.description:
Kids get excited about learning to read with energetic music, zany characters, and fun activities. Please subscribe to Rock 'N Learn's YouTube channel for more fun videos posted every week. Click the numbers below to jump to different parts of the video:

Perfect for any age wanting to build reading skills. After a quick review of upper and lowercase letters, young learners practice the most common sound each letter makes. An on-screen mouth shows how to form the sounds.

Excitement builds as kids race the clock to say letter sounds in silly sentences before hearing the answers. Then, learners play several games along with the video to reinforce their understanding of letter-sound associations that will help them read and spell. They practice consonant combinations that include blends. Finally, after learning some common sight words, kids feel successful reading complete sentences and even short stories.

Rock 'N Learn Letter Sounds has helped people of all ages learn to speak English. This video is often recommended by teachers who specialize in teaching English Language Learners (ELL). Plus, the "on-screen mouth" has been a huge hit with speech therapists. Rock 'N Learn Letter Sounds was developed with speech and language experts to ensure sounds are correctly enunciated.

Telling time is a breeze with the help of Timothy Time, the Clock that Rocks, and his comical friends. Fun music, catchy rhymes, and colorful animation entertain kids of all ages. 

Timothy Time is more than a lovable character. He knows how to clearly explain the concepts of telling time. Unfortunately, many kids do not know how to tell time using an analog clock – one with hands. This the perfect solution.

This video starts off easy and gives clear examples along with lots of humor and musical entertainment. Kids learn to tell time to the half hour, quarter hour, five minutes, and eventually to the minute. This video provides plenty of review and practice so that students build their skills every time it is used.

videos.title: Little Bunny Foo Foo | Rock 'N Learn Kids Song
videos.description:
This little rabbit needs to learn to be kind… or ELSE! Sing and laugh along with this classic song for kids, and remember the important lessons it still holds. Please subscribe to Rock 'N Learn's YouTube channel for more fun videos posted every week.

Little Bunny Foo Foo lyrics:

Little bunny Foo Foo - Hoppin' through the forest
Scoopin' up the field mice and boppin' 'em on the head

Down came the Good Fairy, and she said:
"Little bunny Foo Foo, I don't wanna see you
Scoopin' up the field mice and boppin' 'em on the head!

I'll give you three more chances, and if you don't behave,
I'll turn you into a goon!"

Little bunny Foo Foo - Hoppin' through the forest
Scoopin' up the field mice and boppin’ 'em on the head
 
Down came the Good Fairy, and she said:
"Little bunny Foo Foo, I don't wanna see you
Scoopin' up the field mice and boppin' 'em on the head!
 
I'll give you two more chances, and if you don't behave,
I'll turn you into a goon!"

Little bunny Foo Foo - Hoppin' through the forest
Scoopin' up the field mice and boppin' 'em on the head

Down came the Good Fairy, and she said:
"Little bunny Foo Foo, I don't wanna see you
Scoopin' up the field mice and boppin' 'em on the head!
 
I'll give you one more chance, and if you don't behave,
I'll turn you into a goon!"
 
Little bunny Foo Foo - Hoppin' through the forest
Scoopin' up the field mice and boppin' 'em on the head
 
Down came the Good Fairy, and she said:
"Little bunny Foo Foo, I don't wanna see you
Scoopin' up the field mice and boppin' 'em on the head!
  
I gave you three more chances, and you didn't behave.
Now I'm gonna turn you into a goon!"

And the moral of this story is:
Hare today, goon tomorrow.

https://youtu.be/L0N1v6cxb0o

Your child watches and learns as fun characters present words for body parts, family members, feelings, and more. Eventually, your child starts speaking along. The captivating mouth on screen is helpful for proper pronunciation.  As young children become ready, they develop proper articulation skills through imitation, often for the first time. 

Luci Christian, an award-winning voice actress appearing in dozens of films, uses her talents to get little learners tuned in and talking. Especially useful when you’re concerned your child may not be talking as much as peers. Help ease the frustration of not being able to communicate. 

Busy parents appreciate this self-paced approach children can use with minimal assistance. Along with critical phrases to communicate feelings, children learn parts of the body, parts of the face, and family words. Includes more than 65 words and phrases.

videos.title: I’m a Little Teapot Song and Story - Being Kind
videos.description:
Kids love singing along with this classic, I'm a Little Teapot Short and Stout. Meet a little teapot and her friends in this story song. They learn that everyone is different and has something special to offer. Please subscribe to Rock 'N Learn's YouTube channel for more fun videos posted every week.

I’m a Little Teapot lyrics and script:

Teapot (singing):
I'm a little tea pot, short and stout
Here is my handle; here is my spout
When I get all steamed up, hear me shout
Tip me over and pour me out!

Cup (singing):
I'm a little teacup; I hold tea
Won't you pour some into me?
Add a little honey from a bee
So delicious! You will see!

Saucer (singing):
I'm a little saucer, round and flat
I'm the place where the teacup sat
Sit the teacup on me like a hat
Then you'll know just where it's at!

Oven (singing):
I'm a little oven, I cook food
I'd like to... (sing along with you)  Whoa!

Teapot (interrupting):
Hold on! Waaaait a minute. YOU aren't a teapot... or a teacup... or even a saucer. You have nothing to do with tea. We aren't going to sing with you!

Oven (crying):
Oh no! I'm sorry... boo hoo hoo...

Cup:
Now Teapot, it's always better to be kind. Everyone is different, and everyone has something special to offer.

Teapot:
Okay... I'm sorry I was rude. Oven, you can sing too. Show us what you've got!

Oven:
Really! Oh boy! 

Oven (singing):
I'm a little oven, I cook food
I forgive you for being rude
This will put you all in a good mood
[DING! Oven opens to show cookies]

Teapot:  Wow!

Oven (singing):
I baked cookies and they're oh so good!

[Everyone cheers]

Teapot: Thank you, Oven!

Oven:  You're welcome!

All (singing):   
We can all be friends as you can see
We are as happy as we can be
I am kind to you; You're kind to me
Live together in harmony

Oven: Hoo hoo!   ... Yeah!
Teapot: Yay!
Oven: Oh Yeah!

videos.title: Learn to Read with Phonics | Short Vowels, Consonants, Consonant-Vowel-Consonant Words | Part 1 of 4
videos.description:
Here is the fun and easy way to learn to read with Rock 'N Learn Phonics. Part 1 of our 4-part series covers short vowels, beginning consonants with vowels, oral blending, rhyming words, double consonants, story practice, and more. This proven method complements any reading curriculum at home or in a school classroom. Entertaining animation and fun songs hold attention and get results. Delayed answers and the on-screen mouth let learners check their progress. Read-along stories and songs build fluency. Subscribe to Rock 'N Learn's YouTube channel for more fun videos posted every week. https://www.youtube.com/rocknlearn 

Beginning learners should practice this Phonics Part 1 as many times as needed until they can read the words quickly and easily. Learners will soon be ready for:

Learn to Read with Phonics Part 2 - https://youtu.be/plFuEmwVN4o
Covers consonant blends, digraphs, silent e for long vowels, story practice.

Learn to Read with Phonics Part 3 - https://youtu.be/zZ_6dTb0LOQ
Covers more ways to make long vowels, r-controlled vowels, story practice.

Learn to Read with Phonics Part 4 - https://youtu.be/VQqWs9qIyYU
Covers vowel diphthongs, the schwa sound, ending sounds, rule-breakers, silent consonants, story practice.

Click below to jump to any part of Learn to Read with Phonics - Part 1:
00:00   Rock 'N Learn Title Screen  
00:05   Introduction (Concert Scene with all Characters)
00:49   Vowels (a-e-i-o-u song)
04:56   Consonants Go With Vowels (beginning consonant sounds)

11:36   CGQX (Special Consonants)
14:26   Find The Sounds (phonemic segmentation)
16:41   Sound It Out (oral blending)
19:33   Putting It All Together (Consonant-Vowel-Consonant CVC Words)

24:45   Double Consonants

31:25   Pip Gets a Pat song (review decoding skills)

This is the entertaining, research-based phonics program that has helped so many children and adults learn to read. Rock ‘N Learn Phonics is used in both schools and homes. Busy parents love a self-paced phonics reading program that requires little supervision. Kids love the entertaining songs and games. Parents and teachers love the results. Be sure to subscribe to Rock ‘N Learn’s channel so you know when we post more fun videos. https://www.youtube.com/rocknlearn

videos.title: Did You Ever See a Lassie? - Song for Kids

Did you ever see a lassie?
A lassie, a lassie
Did you ever see a lassie go this way and that?
Go this way and that way and this way and that way
Did you ever see a lassie go this way and that?

videos.title: On Top of Old Smokey with Spaghetti - Cooperation Song for Kids
videos.description:
Brad would like to sing a beautiful version of a classic folk song, but the Spaghetti Chef has some different ideas! Laugh and sing along as they sort out their differences and learn to work together. The result is a hilarious mixture of the original song and the parody, On Top of Spaghetti. It’s a parody of a parody... sort of… 

Please subscribe to Rock 'N Learn's YouTube channel for more fun videos posted every week.

On Top of Old Smokey Mixed with Spaghetti lyrics and script: 

Brad:
Here’s a beautiful song from long ago.
On top of Old Smokey … 

Spaghetti Chef (interrupting):
All covered with cheeeeeeeeese!

[Music stops abruptly]

Brad:
Whoa! Wait a minute. THIS song is about a mountain…

Spaghetti Chef :
Ahhhhh! A mountain of spaghetti!

Brad:
No, No… a REAL mountain, you know, with rocks and trees and snow.

Spaghetti Chef :
Oh, I see. So, no spaghetti?

Brad:
Not in this song.

Spaghetti Chef:
Scusami. So sorry. I’ll let you sing now.

Brad: 
Thank you…

(Music starts again.)
On top of Old Smokey 
All covered with snow

Spaghetti Chef (interrupting):
I lost my poor meatball… 

([Music stops abruptly.)

Brad:
Nope! No meatballs here. 

Spaghetti Chef:
Oh, that’s so sad.

Brad:
Look, why don’t you just let ME sing the song?

Spaghetti Chef:
No problem. I'll just sit over here and listen.

Brad:
Really?

Spaghetti Chef:
Sure thing. I’ll be as quiet as a meatball.

Brad (clears throat – music starts):
Let’s see… from the top…

On top of Old Smokey 
All covered with snow
I lost my true sweetheart
For courting too slow

Spaghetti Chef (interrupting):
She rolled off the table
And onto the floor...

(Music stops abruptly.)

Brad:
What?! What does that even mean?

Spaghetti Chef:
Well, you see, that’s what happened to my meatball.

Brad:
Once again, there are NO meatballs in this song.

Spaghetti Chef:
Oh, that’s right. Now I remember. So very sorry.

Brad:
Listen, I have an idea. Maybe we can sing together and make this work.

Spaghetti Chef:
Bellissimo! I’m ready to rock!

(Both singing together):

On top of Old Smokey
All covered with cheese
I lost my true sweetheart
When somebody sneezed

She jumped off the table
And ran out the door
But we have spaghetti
And now we’ll get more!

Spaghetti Chef:
Ciao!

There's a hole in the bottom of the sea

There's a rock in the hole in the bottom of the sea

There's a rock! There's a rock!
There's a rock in the hole in the bottom of the sea

There's a crab on the rock in the hole in the bottom of the sea

There's a crab! There's a crab
There's a crab on the rock in the hole in the bottom of the sea

There's a fish by the crab on the rock in the hole in the bottom of the sea

videos.title: Money & Making Change
videos.description:
Penny and Bill know how to shake things up when it comes to counting money and making change. Fun songs and activities give plenty of practice with real-world skills. Kids learn about coins and how they relate to one another, strategies for counting coins and bills, "skip counting," expressing money in written terms, strategies for making change, and more.

Children learn how to recognize coins, a little about the history of money, why coins and bills are starting to look different, and much more. They learn strategies for sorting coins and cash and use "skip counting" to find out exactly how much money they have.

After lots of practice counting money, Penny and Bill learn how to make change by pretending to buy funny items at a garage sale. Kids have time to practice counting money and making change along with them before hearing the answers. Join Penny and Bill front row for their concert at the end to celebrate this learning adventure.

videos.title: Greetings in Spanish, French, English, German, Italian and More for Kids | Say Hello in 7 Languages
videos.description:
Learn an important greeting in Spanish, French, English, Italian, German, Mandarin Chinese, and Korean. For a fun brain break in the classroom and to promote multicultural education, this exciting song teaches preschoolers, kindergartners, and older kids to say hello in eight languages. The catchy music will get stuck in your head and help you learn quickly. Kids get so excited when they learn a greeting in a new language. They love going up to adults and other kids and greeting them in a different language. When the other person says, "What??" kids giggle and explain that they are saying hello in the new language. Some kids will learn all of them. Think how fun it can be to impress others that you know how to say hello in 7 different languages. This rocking pop song with animated band characters adds to the excitement.

videos.title: Aprende Inglés para Principiantes - Números, Colores y Más
videos.description:
En esta emocionante aventura, los niños y los principiantes pueden aprender y practicar palabras en inglés para los colores, juguetes, ropa, muebles, y contar hasta 10. Haga clic en los capítulos siguientes para ir a una sección específica.

videos.title: She'll Be Coming Around Mountain with Lyrics | Favorite Kids Song
videos.description: "She’ll Be Coming Around the Mountain" is a favorite song for kids and this version is one of the best you will find. We’ve added lyrics at the bottom of the video screen so you can easily sing along when teaching to your toddler, preschooler, or kindergartner. If you use our videos to sing and learn English, you’ll appreciate this version with lyrics. Lots of fun. Yes, they all come out to meet her, she sometimes wears red pajamas, and she does have to sleep with grandma. Watch our animated kids do a fun dance that’s easy to learn. This song has been a children’s favorite since at least the 1920s. Prior to that, the melody appeared in some spiritual songs and was eventually adapted by railroad workers during the 1890s. You will have so much fun with this version of “She’ll Be Comin’ Around the Mountain.” Aye aye yippee yippee aye, yee haw!

videos.title: Over in the Meadow (with lyrics) | Song for Kids
videos.description:
Over in the Meadow is a fun song for kids. With this version which includes onscreen lyrics, you can sing along. This is perfect for parents, grandparents, and teachers wanting to help children learn the song and sing it with them. It is also useful for helping learn English. This song is also a great song for counting. It's perfect for preschool, kindergarten, or any age.

Over in the Meadow lyrics:

Over in the meadow in the sand in the sun
   lived a kind mother turtle and her little turtle one.
"Wink!" said the mother. "I wink!" said the one
So they winked and they blinked in the sand in the sun.

Over in the meadow where the stream runs blue
   lived a shiny mother fish and her little fishes two.
"Swim!" said the mother. "We swim!" said the two.
So they swam and they swam where the stream runs blue.

Over in the meadow in a hole in a tree
   lived a wise mother owl and her little owls three.
"Hoot!" said the mother. "We hoot!" said the three.
So they hooted and hooted near a hole in the tree.

Over in the meadow in a lodge near the shore.
   lived a brown mother beaver and her little beavers four.
"Dive!" said the mother. "We dive!" said the four.
So they dove and they splashed by the lodge near the shore.

Over in the meadow in a snug beehive
   lived a mother honey bee and her little bees five.
"Buzz!" said the mother. “We buzz!" said the five.
So they buzzed and they hummed in the snug beehive. 

Over in the meadow in a nest built of sticks
   lived a black mother crow and her little crows six.
"Caw!" said the mother. "We caw!" said the six.
So they cawed and they called in their nest built of sticks.

Over in the meadow when the clock strikes eleven 
   there's a noisy mother cricket and her little crickets seven.
"Chirp!" said the mother. "We chirp!" said the seven.
So they chirped cheery notes when the clock struck eleven.

Over in the meadow by the old mossy gate
   lived a scaly mother lizard and her little lizards eight.
"Bask!" said the mother. "We bask!" said the eight.
So they basked in the sun on the old mossy gate.

Over in the meadow where the quiet pools shine
   lived a green mother frog and her little froggies nine.
"Croak!" said the mother. "We croak!" said the nine.
So they croaked and they splashed where the quiet pools shine.

Over in the meadow in a nice little den
   lived a gray mother spider and her little spiders ten.
"Spin!" said the mother. "We spin!" said the ten.
So they spun lacy webs in their nice little den.

videos.title: Learn Korean for Beginners - Part 1 - Conversational Korean for Teens and Adults
videos.description:
"How can I learn Korean fast?" Perhaps you want to learn Korean for K-Pop or another reason. This video series with its unique, proven approach makes it easy and fun to learn Korean quickly. Start learning useful conversational sentences including dating and relationship phrases in Korean right away.

Part 1 covers Korean greetings, introductions, initial conversation (small talk), asking about someone’s interests, polite conversation, and asking someone out on a date in Korean.

Review and repetition are easy when you follow the surprising twists and turns in our entertaining stories. Watch each episode as many times as needed and practice along in Korean. Try out your new Korean phrases with friends. Get ready for success!

New Korean language videos posted weekly, so please subscribe and enable notifications.

Part 1 - "Will You Go Out With Me?"
In this episode, two different couples meet. Follow the first couple as an eager young man pursues a first date with a young woman. Then, for useful practice, speak along in Korean with the same scenario featuring a different couple. This time, the woman is pursuing the man.

What will happen next? Subscribe and enable notifications so you don't miss a single new episode.

videos.title: Wash Your Hands Song for Kids - Happy Birthday
videos.description:
Sing along with a fun song to the tune of Happy Birthday as you learn the best way to wash your hands. Full hand washing song lyrics are on screen during the video and below. After the song, we cover a step by step guide for good hand washing technique with video examples. Here are the hand washing steps we present and demonstrate in the video:

1. Wet your hands with clean, running water (warm or cold), turn off the tap, and apply soap.

2. Lather your hands by rubbing them together with the soap. Lather the backs of your hands, between your fingers, and under your nails.

3. Scrub your hands for at least 20 seconds. You can hum or sing this song through one time.

4. Rinse your hands well under clean, running water.

5. Dry your hands using a clean towel or air dry them.

Nice! Here are some steps to help you wash your hands the best way.

1. Wet your hands with clean, running water (warm or cold), turn off the tap, and apply soap.

2. Lather your hands by rubbing them together with the soap. Lather the backs of your hands, between your fingers, and under your nails.

3. Scrub your hands for at least 20 seconds. You can hum or sing this song through one time.

4. Rinse your hands well under clean, running water.

5. Dry your hands using a clean towel or air dry them.

videos.title: Encouraging Kindness - Parent and Teacher Instructions for "I'm a Little Teapot"
videos.description:
"I'm a Little Teapot" full video here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jtZYTzzdHa8

Hey parents and teachers! Here are some suggestions for using our "I'm a Little Teapot video at home and in the classroom. This free video is a great resource for remote learning.

When working with kids, we are always looking for ways to encourage kindness, right? Kindness at school, kindness among siblings, kindness with friends…

At Rock 'N Learn, we created a video that's a fun twist on a classic song: I'm a Little Teapot.

Our version of the song has the familiar verse about the teapot, but we go on to introduce a tea cup character... and even a saucer.
 
Things are going great until... someone a little different comes along. When oven wants to join in, teapot is not happy. She acts a little rude, and hurts oven's feelings. This provides a great opportunity to encourage kindness. 
 
Teacup saves the day by getting teapot to let oven join in. Finally, oven shows how everyone has something to offer. He makes cookies! What a great way to encourage young learners to include everyone.
 
We hope you'll enjoy using this video at school and in the home. It's great for launching discussions about being kind to others, even if they are different. Watching again can be a helpful reminder of this concept when needed. The link to the video is on screen and in the description of this video. Thanks for watching, and be sure to subscribe.

videos.title: Photosynthesis and Parts of a Plant - for Kids
videos.description:
Watch the full version of our Life Science video here: https://youtu.be/gugUKAzc4O8
Learn about photosynthesis and the parts of a plant with fun animation for students of all ages, especially fourth graders. Learn how plants make their food using water, air, light, and nutrients. Covers chlorophyll and photosynthesis along with the parts of a plant: roots, stems, leaves, flowers, fruits, and seeds. Learn how xylem and phloem cells transport nutrients. Also includes useful information about buds, sepals, petals, pollen, anthers, stamens, filaments, pistils, stigmas, styles, ovaries, and ovules.

videos.description:

videos.title: Five Little Speckled Frogs - With Lyrics
videos.description:
Five Little Speckled Frogs is one of the best preschool and kindergarten songs for learning early math concepts, number sense, recognizing numerals, and identifying more or less of a quantity. Preschoolers form a basic understanding of counting up to five and subtracting from five. Give children a head start for when they learn math in school. Toddlers love this song. They giggle as the frogs jump in the water. This version includes lyrics on screen to make it easy for adults to sing along and share this fun learning experience. Pause the video and count with your child. Watch it over and over and notice children’s progress as they count or sing along. You will begin to discover other learning opportunities in everyday life where you can count objects with your child. Adding or removing objects and counting them helps form a basic understanding of addition and subtraction even with very young children. “Studies show that a child’s math skills at kindergarten entry are a better predictor of future academic success than reading skills, social skills, or the ability to focus,” according to the National Association for the Education of Young Children.

Five little speckled frogs 
sat on a speckled log 
eating some most delicious bugs.  (yum yum)

One jumped into the pool 
where it was nice and cool,
then there were just four speckled frogs.

Four little speckled frogs 
sat on a speckled log 
eating some most delicious bugs.  (yum yum)
 
One jumped into the pool 
where it was nice and cool
then there were just three speckled frogs.

Three little speckled frogs 
sat on a speckled log 
eating some most delicious bugs.  (yum yum)

One jumped into the pool 
where it was nice and cool
then there were just two speckled frogs.

Two little speckled frogs 
sat on a speckled log 
eating some most delicious bugs.  (yum yum)

One jumped into the pool 
where it was nice and cool
then there was just one speckled frog.

One little speckled frogs 
sat on a speckled log 
eating some most delicious bugs,  (yum yum)

He jumped into the pool 
where it was nice and cool
then there were no more speckled frogs.

videos.title: Plant and Animal Cells for Kids
videos.description:
Watch the full free version of our Life Science video here: https://youtu.be/gugUKAzc4O8

What are the differences between plant and animal cells? How are plant and animal cells alike? You might be surprised that there are more similarities than differences. Join Kevin as he transports to the Cellular Learning Center. You will learn that only plant cells have cell walls that are made of cellulose. Both plant and animal cells have a cell membrane surrounding the cell. It allows some things to come in and out of the cell. Both cells have cytoplasm that contains the cytoplasm - the tiny organs of a cell. The nucleus is where all of the genetic material is stored. This genetic material is made of molecules called DNA or deoxyribonucleic acid. The nucleus contains all of the information for running the cell and making new cells. Only animal cells have organelles called centrioles which aid in cell division. Both plant and animal cells have ribosomes. You will also learn about golgi bodies, endoplasmic reticulum, mitochondria, vacuoles, chloroplasts (in plant cells), and lysosomes (in animal cells). This is a lot of material that can be useful for a science test. It is designed to be at about a fourth grade level, but may be useful for students at any grade level, even much higher grades. Teachers will find this to be a wonderful introduction and overview for studying plant and animal cells at any grade level.
